CatDescriptText: William H. Hastie (1904-1976) served as governor of the U.S. Virgin Island from 1946 to 1949, when President Truman appointed him as U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals judge; at that time, Hastie became the only black judge in the federal court system.  In this photograph Hastie stands at a podium in an unidentified room.  Seven individuals, six men and a woman, stand behind him, while the heads of two others appear in the foreground.  Photographs of President Truman and his vice-presidential running mate, Senator Alben Barkley, are taped to the podium.  The same portraits appear on the campaign poster flanking the text: "REMEMBER? Prior to 1933 These Men Pledged & Guaranteed OUR economic FUTURE. [Re]gardless How REGISTERED VOTE STRAIGHT DEMOCRATIC."
TitMainTitle: Governor of Virgin Islands William H. Hastie speaking at podium with posters for Truman presidential campaign
